intro: Selinum tordyliastrum, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. Selinum tordyliastrum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to arid environments.
